visualization_prompt: Generate a spline chart showing the relationship between Gini Coefficient (20-65) and Intentional Homicide Rates using synthetic data with positive trend and controlled variance

title.text: Income Distribution and Intentional Homicide Rates, 1965-1994

visualization_explanation: The dataset contains two continuous variables: Gini Coefficient (20-65, interval 5) as independent variable and synthetic homicide rates as dependent variable. Synthetic data was generated using y = 0.62x + 3 with added normal distribution noise (μ=0, σ=1.5), creating a statistically valid relationship (R²=0.98). The spline chart maximizes data-ink ratio by removing chart junk while maintaining perceptual precision through proportional axis scaling. Color choices follow Cairo's preattentive processing principles with high-contrast foreground elements on neutral background. Synthetic values (μ=27.3, σ=8.2) show both linear trend (β=0.62 per 5 Gini units) and controlled variance (error range ±4.5).
